  • havoc.autoval.tests.wedge.sensor_threshold.sensor_threshold

Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.wedge.sensor_threshold.sensor_threshold

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
# c-put the below imports in order as suggested
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.sensor_threshold import (
    sensor_details, evaluate_value)
import time




[docs]class SensorThreshold(TestBase):
    """ Here we extract sensor info ,enumerate,validate for temperature
        thresholds for memory iteratively """


[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(SensorThreshold, self).__init__()
        self.iterations = self.test_control['iterations']
        self.delay = self.test_control['delay']




[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.passcount = 0
        self.failcount = 0
        self.log_info("This is the sensor threshold test.")
        passcount = int(self.passcount)
        failcount = int(self.failcount)
        error = None
        for iteration in range(1, self.iterations + 1):
            self.log_info("Iteration : %d / %d" % (iteration,
                                                          self.iterations))
            self.log_info("Sleeping for %d seconds" % self.delay)
            time.sleep(self.delay)
            try:
                sensor_info = sensor_details(self, self.host)
                for key in sensor_info:
                    self.validate_condition(evaluate_value(
                        sensor_info[key], self.test_control[key]),
                        "Checking values for %s" % key)
            except Exception as error:
                self.log_info(error)

            if not error:
                self.log_info('All the sensor parameters are in user range')
                passcount += 1
            else:
                self.validate_condition(False, 'Sensor checks failed')
                failcount += 1
                pass
        ppercent = (float(passcount) * 100.0) / float(self.iterations)
        self.validate_condition(
            failcount == 0, 'Passcount=%d:Failcount=%d \n\t \
                \t  :Pass-percent:%.2f' % (passcount, failcount, ppercent))




[docs]def main():
    test = SensorThreshold()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
